column4: I've followed all the guides available for getting dvd's to play and it just won't happen. All the encrypted bits just stay encrypted. tried the medibuntu method too and that doesn't work either. what gives?
yep, none of them play if they've got encryption
clearly it's not giving... what player are you using?
every player under the sun. xine, with any number of ui's, mplayer (again with different ui's), totem, vlc. none work
It would seem that the CSS 'example' script isn't actually running - have you tried running it from source?
I've currently got libdvdcss2 installed from medibuntu
works for most.. suprised it's not working - i would try installing the css script from source and see if it moans
gxine even crashes on start up, helpfully"!
totem-xine suggests that libdvdcss isn't installed, but it really is
It sounds very much like it isn't installed.. have you tried $ sudo apt-get remove --purge libdvdcss2 ; sudo apt-get install libdvdcss2
just done that, still get the same error
Sorry, no idea - not heard of it just not working before, maybe it's a dvd drive problem?
the same dvd worked before when i was running gentoo. same hardware
no idea, hit launchpad answers if i were you.  https://answers.edge.launchpad.net/ubuntu (or the forums)
could it be the region setting? wondering if the region mask is wrong
